ujeZDAqzEAWmHQq7eqgq8w.text: This place is the best. Quick service, delicious food, and friendly staff. I have been a customer since the day I moved into the neighborhood and I still can't get enough. I love the authenticity of the preparation and the laid back vibe in the place. I have absolutely no complaints. This is consistent NY style goodness! Perfect for the family or a casual date night.

46zdpckvg-ICCspQFjrweQ.text: Friendly staff and quick and easy take out. We got a Sicilian pie to go and it was delicious! You can taste the fresh basil in the sauce. Very close to NY style and flavor! We will be back for more!!

XUnfBxSEH2aG6Eaz4oUPVg.text: I go out of my way to eat here. Great pizza and family atmosphere with enough variety to make multiple visits seem fresh.

SUr5KJcDm4U1rG6kufbwFA.text: I eat here about once a week now. The value you get for your dollar is great as the portions are pretty large, and it is pretty cheap for Italian. Entrees come with soup or salad, I always get soup and Ive had like 3 or 4 different soups and not a single one has disappointed. Ive had multiple entrees, all but one were very good, the one I didnt care for lacked flavor and I believe it was because they were busy and I let it slide. Only had a plain slice one time and that was probably the best you will find in the area, very solid pizza (I was born and raised in NY). Overall a great spot for a relatively inexpensive, relaxing night out with the old lady or the whole family. Solid italian food.

AN8DBJ6L1mySxwr6I4JfKQ.text: Delicious and affordable. The stromboli was awesome  (I had one with spinach, garlic and mushrooms). Although we were visiting Charlotte, we would definitely try them again.

UbQWHPBJrh5DXqixUY3czw.text: Very authentic food. Friendly staff and never had any issues. We eat here frequently or get it to go as well. For non-chain italian food this is our GO-TO!

HL7oxJO3Ba5MyuqjyV0o0g.text: A nice, small Italian restaurant in the Brookdale Plaza on Rocky River off I-485, it has great Veal Parmigiana and all kinds of pizzas.  It's a very inexpensive getaway and Frank Sinatra lovers will definitely frequent the place because his songs are constantly being played. Ask for Holly to be your waitress.

ID9GBWPaO1Yc4K8-6kmc8w.text: Very good, quality food every time. Owner is really nice and his employees seem happy to work there.

q_XytDnD8t4m5sQTUUt9Ig.text: The absolute best NY style pizza un Charlotte. The two men who own Capriccios are Italian and lovely! We typically get their large cheese pizza (good pizza doesn't need toppings in my opinion) or the Stromboli. Either are enough to feed a small army and are excellent.

qIQSOUSzRLMnXKW_54uP8Q.text: Stromboli  HEAVEN. Havnt had one that good since I left New York. Great calamari, seafood and eggplant dishes as well. Good cheesecake as well! Portion sizes are perfect to fill you up, except for the tormented stromboli. A large can feed a family of four.

L8xu5nHKw7GSCB4lCs_PeQ.text: Excellent food!!!!!! We had chicken parm and it was one of the best we have had in Charlotte!  They also had great home made salad dressing! Great little Italian place, great value too!

uCvH9yD0nXLEVNWkHei9Gg.text: This has ended up being out go-to place for take out or dine in Italian.  Wait staff is awesome, bread and salads don't hurt my feelings and the courses are huge and well seasoned.  My initial concerns have been put to rest.  Thank you Capriccio's

CKzGHQBiwFZ2Xk4YyDSLGQ.text: Pizza was good.  Not bad.  Other pasta items are excellent! Surprisingly good for an Italians place in a strip mall.

YBFC96UyWRaKOoCuFJNU2g.text: Huge pizza fan here, and let me say I will eat just about any pizza out there. Unfortunately I was very disappointed. The owner is very nice service was great. Over all a nice place, but if your looking for some great pizza I would not recommend.

EhSHx7HYibwiSBa5ttxWNQ.text: Best authentic food in Charlotte. We eat them 1-2 times a week. From the pizza, to the gnocchi and even the wings, you won't find any better.

UMdp9o-3BwHyBvz8ZP0Atw.text: I stopped eating out at basic Italian places because... Heck I can fix most of these items better than they do!  This place is no exception.  I only come here because my "special" somebody (as in he is really special when it comes to his taste bud or the lack thereof) truly thinks this place has the best pizza. My dear yelper friends, read my lips, they do NOT have the best pizza.  Nothing here is memorable. To be fair, their food are edible and especially if you are hungry and you are stuck out that way (hence 2 stars)   Truth is their marinara sauce was tart. I had to work on it at the table in order for it to not taste like it came from a can. Meatballs were blend and a little tough. Pizza looked under-cooked.  Service was never great. I really think it is a waste of a restaurant because they obviously have a core support group in order for it to be still in business. So either all their regulars do not know what real and good Italian food taste like or... Sadly I can't think of another reason.

4hC6S0sHav8AAQE72k3YQQ.text: I love a good slice of pizza, loaded with cheese,and just enough sauce and the right combination of herbs and I  though I found the perfect place in Capriccio...but lately the pizza is tasteless, soggy and not good at all.  Not sure if they let it go to their head that the pizza was that good... or did they change the staff... but whatever it is PLEASE go back to the way you use to make pizza.....please :)   I really miss my slice !

rFVwHNv1rBItUb3_-Jpajw.text: Love this place, authentic pizza- great salads & pasta. Friendly staff - so glad to have this place.

R8XHz1AgbcyTPFGVWWCsdA.text: NY-style pizza is my favorite and Capriccio's is the best I've found in metro Charlotte. Very good NY style pizza, very good price, and they even make good, strong iced tea. I've driven 20 minutes out of my way just for their pizza.  If you like NY-style, go!

GxXSYTLyqYQm_k5xyHeKvw.text: Great place to eat Italian. Very authentic dishes.  Excellent wait staff. Price is very good for the amount of food you get.

-xl4lCdAIvqksU0yXc2YUQ.text: I eat at this place at least 2-4 times a month and usually get the pizza with chicken and meatballs (beef), Always fantastic.  I'm a New Yorker, so I know good pizza and Capriccio has the BEST pizza.  I've tried other dishes (Chicken Marsala, Arrabiata, Lasagna) and they're ok.  I will say the pizza is fantastic and they sell it by the slice (like home).  I would highly recommend this place!

INYCGjBEE19P278HuTIUAg.text: Love love love Capriccios! My family and I have been coming here since 2007 and the pizza/pasta is always good. Every time we visit we feel like family and I will never eat pizza any where else.

WVtzYNwlH10-7hod9fxq5A.text: I've never had a bad meal here. The pizza is awesome!! The dishes are always made after ordering and arrive hot! Their bread is even great!

y-1GSK-QfkuZZSklAwRNXA.text: First time to the restaurant. Service was good. Ambiance was poor - chair rails and walls all scuffed up, and the place could use some kind of ceiling divider to keep the bright white kitchen lights out of dining area.   But we were there for the food. The soup was pasta fagioli -  a cream base rather than tomato and it tasted more like a bean soup. It was good. Ordered the chicken special and a pizza to share.  Chicken dish had two chicken breasts covered with prosciutto and smokey mozarella, with pasta and sauce. A bit salty but the chicken and pasta was cooked perfectly. It was a huge serving - more than enough to share and take extras home. The pizza was cheese, sausage, onion and pepperoni. Again, good sauce and flavors, but it was quite greasy. Will definitely go back,but will probably ask for a table near the front windows.

5m-GGK_9Z2EC_bLCMe1rUw.text: Been here on multiple occasions with friends and family. The food is excellent, and most of the staff is usually on top of things. It's usually pretty quiet, so it's a nice little gem in the area. It normally seems a little short staffed, so be prepared for a longer wait than usual.

lGB26zvJm_e9O5RHGCZAfg.text: I have enjoyed everything I've eaten here.  Sometimes the service is a bit slow but over all it's a good place in the Harrisburg area for your pizza and Italian food.

vJHwKwtSdX5xR1iZweEDXg.text: I can't speak to the pizza (which seems to get mixed reviews here), but I had the caprese salad and mozzarella sticks appetizer with their bread (which was both complimentary and complementary) and left with a smile on my face.  Which is saying something because I only stumbled across this place since it was within walking distance of the repair shop where my car had to be towed.  I most definitely wasn't smiling when I went it.   There's nothing complicated about what I ordered, so some people might discount that as easy to get right; however, I disagree. I've been to a lot of restaurants that can't get the simple stuff right and this one definitely did.  Creamy buffalo mozzarella fried to perfection without being greasy and homemade ranch that was satisfyingly thick enough to have the True lusciousness a good ranch dressing should. Then perfectly sliced, wonderfully fresh roma tomatoes layered with thick slices of buffalo mozz (no skimping here!) and obviously fresh herbs with a bit of olive oil served with a carafe of balsamic so you can drizzle till your heart's content.  Warm, crusty bread served with creamy butter that arrives at the table at room temperature for ready-to-spread goodness that's hard to beat.    The service was average (not exceptional, but not worthy of ridicule.) The food, on the other hand, was fresh, flavorful, and simply spectacular.

focZfD_mbQVJvEeqR66vlg.text: Best Italian in Charlotte! Pizza is yummy & pasta sauce is the best. True authentic Italian!

7XIIxhRsO2AOnHA358-H-w.text: I don't branch out and try various menu items here because I am obsessed with their lasagna and salad with house dressing! The service is always friendly and personable. And those cannoli... heavenly! A True gem of a restaurant!

5c7I85vVXakNTm9AyHiQVw.text: We have only tried the take out. Their pizza is addicting! We love the crust and sauce especially. They are always fast and the order is ready on time.

7Z0Rj-85ymVTp8nW-KEuQg.text: TERRIBLE service .... and the best part is these people could care less!!!! Last time I ever step foot in this place!

Z3wgVTZgPSBFMEE9NtyhpQ.text: I ordered the baked ziti and my husband ordered the sorrento. As soon as we were home,  we were both sick. Our kids had the pizza and they were fine. We won't be going back.

rmmMTKj-A3cc5sgcGUUGaQ.text: If you are from anywhere north of Maryland, you no doubt miss pizza. As an Italian kid from Philly, I end up cooking all my own food, because I'll be dam ned if I'm eating some Olive Garden nonsense.  The we discovered Capriccios.   Since I was in college, we'd drive over to the south Harrisburg area when we had a few extra bucks to spend to get the real deal slice. Now, I live closer by and have the privilege to eat here whenever I want, and nothing could make me happier.  The food is amazing, the gnocchi, the meats, everything. Thank you Capriccios, you make it taste like home!

iQsJD8t2ZGdhTm3yz010VA.text: Have not had a bad meal there yet. The Portions are great and the prices are not too bad. It is truly authentic just like my Italian Grandmother!

bp-2JLvlM5MdLIGxn7HVtQ.text: Walked in with my fiance 30ish minutes before closing, and no one seemed irritated that we had come so close to closing!  (We haven't had the best of luck with they lately...)  We sat right down as the restaurant was nearly empty.  We ordered an appetizer - stuffed mushrooms.  They were good, but probably not something I will order a second time.   Our food came out promptly.  Our meals came with choice of soup or salad, which can be hard to find these days!  My chicken Parmesan was AMAZING and I cannot wait to go back for more!  This classic dish was prepared perfectly and pleased my taste buds!  Definitely recommend this place to others!

Ed7yfomNW3AwE6ZO9vUroQ.text: Just loved the homemade bread, lentil soup, stuffed mushrooms and pizza. Relaxed atmosphere. Friendly waiters. Family oriented. What's not to like?

NqsZBr1_pr3_e2CmKrqdcg.text: There are only two pizza places I'll eat at and this is number one for me. I get a large Pepperoni pizza every weekend. The owner and staff are super nice even the cooks are nice to me! New York style pizza and super fresh. I know it's strange but they have a great Philly cheese steak too. When my meat eating friends are in town we go for a large all meat pizza and that is also great. I can't speak on the other Italian dishes but the pizzas out of this world. Locally owned and operated you can't beat it.

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Boom!

NFSiphsmX0UJQL6-u3ecVg.text: Delivers on what it intends to be. Good food in an easy, relaxed atmosphere. The complimentary bread is so delicious. Haven't yet had the pizza but the veal parmigiano, chicken marsala, and ravioli dishes are quite good. Great place to drop in for lunch or dinner. Have found service to be quick and efficient.

dP1JThgSaG-4p5enjdMbzg.text: By far the BEST pizza in Charlotte...but it doesn't stop there. The owner and staff are so warm and friendly. You always feel welcomed and special! The grilled chicken salad is wonderful, the pasta dishes are great, you will be very pleased whatever your meal selection. I love Cappricios!!!

7p7974wkRbI_wZ5oiKjAhw.text: Best pizza in Charlotte area. Made by a meticulous Italian guy who rolls out 1 pie at a time. We are from NY and have not found anything else comparable.

FebJiwhcXimQ4K67uQZtvw.text: My husband and I just moved up to this area!! Since moving to NC we have not found a real deal Italian restaurant! We gave this place a try, ordered for take out, and we were beyond impressed! We come from the North and my husband is full Italian so it's hard to find great Italian! I think we found it! We will eat in next time!!

Qi_Pzb4huxGnVWzB0e62Fg.text: Really good Tortellini Special (tortellini with shrimp & broccoli in alfredo sauce. My husband had stromboli & they subbed bacon for mushrooms with no issues. My daughter got the kids' spaghetti & meatballs. Portions were very large & we had leftovers to take home. So yummy & waitress was very friendly & attentive. The Riesling was delicious!

ZCAGgPSadnZIsKjZJy45lg.text: One of the better pizza joints in the Charlotte area. Thin and saucy with great toppings and generous cheese. It's more NY style than most places nearby - it's a solid choice!

ijYGyIy5lAIecX-ud5t_eg.text: We love this place. Pasta is always good. Portions are decent. A little expensive but it's worth it to me. I love the lasagna and the chicken pastini soup. They give you a real bowl of soup, not some small cup. I have yet to try anything that I haven't like. I have not tried the pizza but it looks delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.

jbL42SS3p-2EpqXyHzLplA.text: You know when you bite into a good quality flavorful tasting slice of pizza... this was not one of them.

B4F0rH4Ks6T-QvF-Yxfigg.text: Save ur money or go somewhere else. Sauce was bland & watery. Had one slice of my pizza & threw it away. Same for the lasanga.

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States

Um5IeY5nlp6DAwY5eR9-Nw.text: First time here and very impressed! The dining room has a very Italian ambiance with a map of Italy and old school blk&wht pictures on the wall and high quality tables and chairs. The sweet tea was really really good and we had the eggplant parm, stuffed peppers and NY pizza. Everything was awesome! The bathrooms could use some work and the salad was ok but will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood combo
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soup is amazing!
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States

ctfgwB4GzE2RQncAAuQbFg.text: We always have excellent food and service here, the grilled chicken salad is really tasty and so is the Italian sausage sandwich

KTUozxGeKsVUVcVKcGBsRg.text: Really good cheese pizza. Tried the pizza, the cheese was very good, the sauce was sweet and tasted great with the cheese. Having tried lots of pizza places recently I can say that Capriccio is very good, I would say their prices for a whole pizza are a bit high and that can be improved on but a solid choice. Another place that tastes like capriccios is Da Vinci's so I suggest trying them if needing any new pizza places.

w5GxoVIPnbIE0F4OVGVoLQ.text: Went here for dinner with the husband. I had heard it was really good and being from NY am always on a search for authentic Italian. I loved the atmosphere and that place does a mean business! The line was out the door for pickup. I went with the Chicken Passion, which was delicious! Chicken and bowtie pasta with broccoli in mushrooms in a marinara sauce. The sauce was spot on and everything was seasoned to perfection. My husband had lasagna which he and I both thought was subpar. Definitely not bad or made poorly just the way they make their lasagna we didnt like. We prefer a thicker lasagna. This didn't have a ton of meat or sauce on it. I am definitely going again to try the pizza and I will update my review. Their pie looked amazing!

QsGfRphcJsvn66uY_Hv3fQ.text: We got take out from here after moving into a neighborhood nearby and were so happy to find such a great Italian spot so close to the new house!  The pizza was fabulous, their house dressing was great and the service was friendly.  We will be back soon!

hYG8txlAcGhtu4nSW7N-jQ.text: My husband and I decided to give this little Italian restaurant a try. We have come across some real authentic Italian treasures this way, however this was NOT one. We had soup and salad which was ok and each ordered their Stromboli ... It comes with mushroom, sausage, and pepperoni. My husband asked to hold the mushrooms. The sauce was poor quality canned marinara. The dough was still raw in the center through out the Stromboli. Mine, which had mushrooms, was 50% stuffed with cheap canned mushrooms.  We ate what we could from opening it and eating around the raw dough. When we brought it to the waiters attention he explained that all restaurants get the same complaint  The "Owners" never offered to come speak with us and made it clear that they could care less about the low quality and undercooked food. We paid 29.49 and tipped the waiter his appropriate 15% ( we normally tip at least 30%).... Don't waist your money!!!! There are plenty of really good restaurants that deserve and appreciate your business... This is not one!!!!If I could rate it zero stars, I would!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States

qo3zlciwg2uQ05p29kA9tw.text: Hostess started our experience with "sorry I'm not good at this seating people". We were ready to order food when she asked about drinks but the waitress/hostess left immediately after our drink orders. Salad dressing came in a lidded to-go container on the side of the dish. Pasta serving was decent but not large, and absolutely swimming in Alfredo sauce. I didn't want to finish the pasta because of the amount of sauce (about a cup more than necessary).

_JhIhRRL3FJ-dJ2SC7zZiw.text: My boyfriend and I come here on the rare occasion. Their pizza is fair. If you like super greasy, razor thin slices with more of an "orange sauce," than a good hearty red sauce.  They used to have the small added touch of cloth napkins that has now been reduced to paper napkins and less than satisfying service. During this particular dining experience, my boyfriend and I sat with empty glasses that were finally refilled as we were finishing our meal. We then sat for an inappropriate amount of time waiting to ask our waitress for a box and our check to which we were then asked to "give her a second." From that point on, all charm and eye contact was no longer offered.   I think I'll settle for oven pizza at home next time, because it seems like this place has jumped the shark.

FBPwy1KMqAmdk61PH9Wg0A.text: Fooood is soooo yummy!!  Ive been going for years and they never disappoint! When im  not on my next health gig and want something cheesy and carb-y im always down for this place. Very authentic feel too!!

ClC3pu012tKiy_0iwuhPoA.text: Went there on a Friday night to dine in.  Be aware they do an INCREDIBLE carryout business, especially on Friday nights. So the incredibly long line that you will be waiting in is for carry out pizza, not to be seated. We did call ahead and they reserved a table for us which was very nice on a Friday night. Food was great our server was great, and it's a cool place. We will definitely go back again. And even though we didn't order pizza, our server was so nice she brought us a slice so that we could try it and it was amazing. Strongly recommend this place.

xJr6flqgrhgsBztAJW0NzQ.text: Not sure why it took me so long to write a review for this place, because I am here all the time.  It is quick, close to home and tasty.  It does remind me of pizza joints that you would find in NY, grease and all.  So far I have tried their cheese pizza, ziti and lasagna and everything has been really good, satisfying, very reasonably priced and consistent.  Consistency is a big deal for me, when I go to Capriccio's I know what to expect every time.  The owner is very friendly and he really puts the effort into making sure you are happy with your visit.  Way to go Capriccio's!!  Keep up the good work!!

x6SaUqD4P7x0I2nYSq0TQA.text: If you want a bread pizza with few toppings, this is the place to go.  It feels authentic in many ways, but there are much better Italian restaurants in Charlotte.

MK3NYG1joa0-vAj3MgIWgA.text: Cute place! The food was very good & the service was AMAZING! Super friendly & fast! And very reasonably priced (lunch)...Wish we lived closer, but we'll definitely stop when we come up this way!

NhTDTt0LzpoTZXtQU3o--A.text: This place is awesome!  I'm not Italian but I venture to say it's authentic. Homemade sauce! Homemade bread!  What more could you ask for. I have never been disappointed with any menu item. Love, love, love this place!

DO2GMTOs5rxNhA0fTVjU6Q.text: How have I never written a review for this little gem in Harrisburg?!  We visit Capriccios at least once a month.  It's a small authentic Italian restaurant with owners straight from Italy.  Their food is ALL very good!  I have tried a variety of items from pizza to pasta to salads to strombolis- and it never disappoints!    My favorites- their house balsamic dressing-  AMAZING- I have actually just ordered salads to go in order to have this dressing!  Their bread!  They bake it as you need it- it's doughy fresh and hot!  The butter melts on it and we always eat more than we should.  My husband gets grilled chicken salads and they are huge and delicious!  Especially the Caesar.  Everything is homemade here, and fresh!    We are lacking restaurants in Harrisburg!  If you in the mood for Italian and are on the fence try it- knocks Dino's and Hawthorne's out of the park food wise!  It's a bit more quaint- but service is good- or take to go.  Small beer and wine menu, and some amazing looking homemade tiramisu too!

6ExDUqjFgsYqNgjQoxnuRQ.text: Had a little bit of everything Charlotte has to offer during my stay, as far as the food goes. When it came to looking for something Italian, this was the place. And it will be another time too. Good menu, good service, good portions and good prices. As far as I recall everything was under $20 and that was one of the selling points, besides the positive reviews. And they don't lie. I forgot the waitress's name but she was also very helpful. So if you're not sure where to go, try here.

qkraD7fRwX2zZY6283QSLw.text: Ok i have lived in charlotte for 13 years and this place has always hit the spot, authentic italian food with great people and great family style atmosphere. Shrimp fra diablo is good and any type of pizza. Def a good italian spot

Xq0Vi9oofRcl4Khp4Qk3zA.text: Excellent italiyan! (Southern way) love their food, chicken Parm is great, balsamic dressing is food, although wish they also had a homemade house Italian dressing. Lunch specials are great, come here usually at least once a week

RDSsnMdKrlNkmN798Qnm-g.text: Simply awesome ...A quaint little restaurant with great food and service! Much better than Carrabas Italian Restaurant!

3arSR0zx4C4Ji-g_mfpFYw.text: This was a great, authentic Italian place. Small, family owned place. I had the soup and salad and others had pizza and loved it. Great service, great value!

hAKAzW_RVKFxZBwh-3gT3A.text: Tried this place on vacation again, & changed my review to disappointed and not worth the wait.    They burnt the first cheese pizza. After a long wait, the second wasn't like I remembered. I only ate it because I was soo hungry.  The time before I had an amazing pizza and penne ala vodka.  Can't say I'd recommend it after my last experience!

xn2gbutbzYAZr4nB29qtCA.text: This is a great spot for those living in the Rocky River/Bradfield Farms area! It's a nice family Italian spot that a lot of people don't know about. They have good lunch specials, great fresh bread, and their chicken Alfredo is amazing!!! They also have good pizza with huge slices!!! Great for the family to bring home for dinner.

kda8dDeNfMNafPIVqEbNsA.text: Very good philly cheesesteaks, they come in a big box with lots of fries. The pizza are really good as well loaded with toppings of your choice. Prices are pretty reasonable. You can sit inside or order out and they staff is very friendly.

ASvBzpvtKc1XDYshKOpn3g.text: Great pizza and friendly staff! We are new to the area and have been looking for a go-to pizza place. We have tried many different places and this is by far my favorite. Being from the north we love a good NY style pizza and this has been the closest thing to it. We ordered a large cheese and it did not disappoint, perfect amount of cheese, tasty sauce and a thin crust. We are love king forward to trying one of their specialty pizzas and wings!

WPmie9pr4Zb8wQimsEKErg.text: This place is reliable goodness. We have been coming here for years and never tire of the food or wonderful staff. If you are ever even near this place and desire great Italian this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States

wJmANvNyclY7xCLLWiLzEQ.text: Wow what happened to customer service?!?!? Waiter was very short and acted like we were a bother. We both got baked ziti which was absolutely flavorless. Added salt, pepper, cheese and red peeper flakes which maybe it half was editable. Marina tasted like bland tomato soup.

u3uJjlC8w92YPcYegsfYaA.text: Stopped in for lunch with a friend while in the area. I got the capriccio with penne. It's a cream presto sauce and has chicken. Wow! I could have licked the plate clean. I did use bread when the pasta and chicken were gone. My friend got veal marsala. He really liked his as well and cleaned his plate. It's a small place tucked away by the harris teeter, but do yourself a favor and seek this place out. I wish they were closer to where I live. Lunch was $19 after tax before tip. We just drank water.

hYjzA2d4GcP3x1ygffplzg.text: Authentic Italian cuisine delicious very inviting, bright atmosphere. Am impressed every time I go.

jX4HnNNJQNkchjT-DCqBZQ.text: Best pizza in Harrisburg, hands down! Pasta dishes are fantastic as well - everything on the menu is good, and the staff is quick and very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza awesomeness

Jn1kqotBj9zp7VpjMVvGCw.text: New York transplants are always on a mission to find great pizza in Charlotte. A friend (and fellow New Yorker) told us to check out this place for the great pizza, we were pleasantly surprised!  The restaurant was crowded (a good sign) and smelled like a NY Pizzeria (an even better sign)!  The garlic knots were great and so was our half mushroom pie, thin crust with quality sauce and cheese!!. Our server Rosie was very friendly and attentive. Wish we knew about this place years ago!! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half Mushroom Pie
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Knots

o3OWE5aD8ZoymJI9P69CMA.text: Disclaimer: I got the pizza to take home, so if I come back and it's really good again, I'd have no problem giving the 5th star.  I grabbed Carpiccio to go on my way from UNCC home based off of the great reviews. I got a cheese pizza, and the gentlemen said it would be about 15 minutes, so I went next door to Harris Teeter to grab some things. When I came back, the pizza was hot and ready. It wasn't terribly expensive at around $12.  It was really good. Up there with the best in Charlotte. I think Capriccio sits at #2 behind Due Amici's and ahead of Brooklyn Pizza for the best, although the service at Capriccio is better than both of them. The pizza had a great cheese to sauce to bread ratio--nothing was overpowering. A lot of places like to overdo the cheese, but not here. The pizza wasn't terribly greasy, either which is always appreciated.  I'd stop by again and eat there to see how it is, but for now, great pizza, good service. I'd give it a shot for lunch if you're in the area!

7DnsPkHxgzzSxb_SIROwkQ.text: Such great pizza which keeps us going back. We have only ordered carry out so we can't speak for the waitstaff but EVERY time we order and take out, the counter staff there seem pissed off and so not welcoming. It says a lot about Their pizza that we go back because I can't stand the employees' attitudes. It's similar to Seinfeld's Soup Nazi... only not funny.

3YwGPV5YoVDcfLvjWMWRrQ.text: Love the cheese slices!! Taste just like NY! Food is fresh and quick, the salads are to die for and don't forget house dressing..

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese Slices $1.75 each

q1yj__kNvo5l25VnhtO5dA.text: I went here for lunch. Great place if your craving pizza and wings. Sweet tea is tasty, waitress (Nikki) was very polite. Try this place out if your in the area!

XCUvCJjFNWNcny0BWDUrTw.text: We have been here a few times now and have not been disappointed. Large portions on the pasta and a great sauce, particularly the pesto. I have had several of the pastas and enjoyed each of them. We have not tried the pizza yet, perhaps next time

CVOqe1qZtKzbrwJ4S1s6rw.text: This restaurant was so good I went back the next day. The calamari was crispy, light, and well seasoned. The stuffed mushrooms were delicious. The basil & mozzarella dish is simple but tasty.  The only issue I had was with lemon chicken dish. The sauce on the spaghetti was too thin but it tasted decent.  Unfortunately, I was not a big fan of the pizza. It was way too thin for my liking. Overall, this is a solid spot & I look forward to going back.

II17PHXcVKJutRV7owHHHA.text: Visited for the first time and had a great dinner. The place was slammed! Only 2 servers working for a full restaurant but they were awesome. Our server Maddie was fantastic. Quick service and everything came out perfectly. We really enjoyed everything we ordered but loved the pizza! A lot of people were coming in just for order pick ups and I see why. We are moving to this area in a few weeks and will be ordering pizza from here from now on. The pizzas are very large so they are worth the money! If you have a large group or don't feel like waiting for a table I would suggest calling ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Medium pizza

T5xAoDUEQIqHTRKaXKi_AA.text: My family and I are new to the area so we are trying out restaurants.  This place was pretty packed during lunch.  My husband would like to try the pizza to give a solid review.  I had the Eggplant parmesan and it wasn't bad.  I didn't see the ham in it as suggested on the menu.  My husband had a chicken dish that he wasn't fond of.  My boys has a cheesesteak and they enjoyed that.  Overall we as a family will return especially based on the reviews and we looked around and the pizza looked so good

aVRImzCiguv508Dg6o2w0w.text: Great place to eat dinner.  Food is really very good. Not good for a really large group; inside is on the smaller side.

2rDCtQbSTn_EBzr3ohNniw.text: Pretty much a solid Italian place.  Good house dressing and great red sauce for the pizza.  I try to order different dishes each time I go, so I have tried many dishes there.  I really like the lasagna and the cheese pizza!! They are both my faves.  Extremely authentic and makes me feel like I'm back east.  The service is iffy but who cares it's an Italian place - take it easy and enjoy your food!! Don't eat so fast!!!

hqPwjiLmVi4ekCYhaHRBkg.text: Walked in today and the cook was literally standing in the kitchen over the food eating. Couldn't believe it. Me and the family turned around and walked out. We just got food from here a few days ago so that really disappointed us.

yCZdNBlyU-i2xS7pfX4dYw.text: Best salads in town. Loved the shrimp Alfredo too. So so good. Very friendly staff as well. I wish I could literally eat here everyday. Their bread could be a little under backed at times but everything else has been good so far. I cannot wait till try out other pasta and salad dishes.  (Ps...even fries were really fresh and tasty. Give this place a try.)  Update: Trues fish/seafood salad today with side salad. Not my favorite but not bad either.

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish/sea food salad. Served cold.
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side salad with no cucumber
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled chicken salad

EvTzcRmIwcD5GHr5dfyarw.text: This is hands down the best Italian restaurant in Harrisburg!  Great pizza, pasta, and everything!

NVKZQ3rl5UK8QjqyM1I1tw.text: Wow!! Just wow!! The flavors here  are really really good. We ordered take-away tonight with my in laws who just moved here from California. This place rivals some of the best  places there. We ordered lasagna,ziti, shrimp Alfredo. Every meal was super fresh and flavorful. Thank you guys for a taste of  wonderfulness!!!

NA35NlDLVzdh2NbpPu5Rrw.text: The best Italian food and service. Gravy is excellent, pasta, fish, veal, Stromboli, pizza all sono buoni!

OW4QxXXHVH1vJVtLfVmpzw.text: Best Italian and pizza in the Charlotte/Concord area. Owners are from Naples and bring the authentic cooking to NC. Always a great meal!

YnbjG5hxxhdbSeRNlt894g.text: If you're in Charlotte NC looking for some real NY pizza this is the spot.I have been to a few places one was a regular since going here I have not been back to any of the other places.

8Z0OZxN8eDIiVurox5O1zw.text: I've ordered from here twice before  and I was happy to find we had an Italian restaurant that I liked so close to home.   Today, that changed.  I ordered the same Carbonara pasta that I have in the past, but it was a completely different entree.  It should have been a creamy pink sauce and it was a clumpy white "something" on mushy overcooked pasta.   Let's say they gave me the wrong order and that still does not change the fact that it was sauce was dry  and tasteless.   It looked like leftover pasta that sat in the frig at least a couple of days.  I had to toss it.  Before today, I could not believe some of the negative reviews but I found out that it is hit or miss with this place.  I will probably still order pizza, but I will forgo the pasta.  I was extremely disappointed.

UPFsg7WHihae84otGrTntg.text: Started with pizza to go but always wanted to try an entree. Tonight I had the opportunity and wasn't disappointed. Pizza is advertised as New York style but this is better than any such style that I've had. Plenty of sauce, generous gourmet toppings and a delicious crust. The dine in experience was equally enjoyable. We were promptly seated and the service was exceptional throughout the evening. Soup was an Italian chicken noodle that came with complimentary bread. Both were excellent. Cheese ravioli and spaghetti with meat sauce did not disappoint but I would recommend the shrimp scampi. The even have a full kids menu for the little ones. My only suggestion would be to offer a beer on draft or two. You can't really go wrong with Capriccio.

JFAZJhThGzU-r1NtSkopBA.text: By far the best lasagna I've had in North Charlotte! The owner is native Italian so what you are getting is his American spin on Italian cuisine! They are closed on Mondays but you can always find parking and a seat when you go. PS- you've gotta put crushed red pepper on that lasagna...it is a game changer, you're welcome! Also...it reheats beautifully!

TIVfI_fNklGewL06_jx_Dw.text: This is a wonderful hidden gem from most of town, yet they have Italian perfected. From the lasagna to the muscles to of course the Pizza. They have a great antipasto salad with pickled veggies, and lastly the fresh baked bread paired with the marinara sauce...ooooweeee!

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio Picatta Very lemon tangy
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stromboli
Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sesfood pasta!

TSS9mHt9Ol0u6J3n06rKDw.text: Best neighborhood Italian restaurant, the food and service are great. I can't speak to the pizza, but I love their pasta and wings.   Once I had a cold and came in to pick up my order after a trip and one of the owners gave me a bowl of their homemade soup, it was excellent rich and bold broth with their oven made bread, like something you would get from your Grandma's home. This is one of my personal favorite's.

kMUsP9_OEi4ZXiP-4Kb4-A.text: I guess i went on an off day. The pepperoni pizza was salty, greasy, and rubbery. Mediocre at best...

photos.caption: Photo of Capriccio - Charlotte, NC, United States. I really wanted to like this, but it wasn&#39;t very good.

cPNI08RcITcrDINAsEzahw.text: This food is good. Tastes fresh food is not salty food comes fast. The cooks speak Italian and they play Sinatra Will come again. 2-23-19 4:45pm Very good. Waiter friendly

FFVdzvHAI-bf3l7tJzLYDw.text: Anthony the owner is from Naples , Italy.  He is a great cook and an even better person.  YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE.  NY NJ people in NC this is back home stuff.  In many ways a tad better.  This guy takes NO SHORT CUTS when he cooks.  All of the food is good.  I specifically love the veal and their pizza is very , very good.  The service is excellent.  The place is spotless.   SECRET-  If their is something on the menu that you do not see, or you want something made special, tell him and he will make it for you.  ie-  Broccholi Robb and sausage.  Madone, can he cook.

WB0omL4QWc_ZYNPo3q_w4A.text: New Yorker..... this place even smells right! I have never been disappointed! So happy to find my comfort food!

wgUpKA94PufsPkX626SerQ.text: Best pizza in town, traditional ny style and they also have sicilan which is my favorite

hgypb-fDcD1FmKwEaDjk4w.text: wait staff was very polite, and the food delicious and home made . The bathroom was also very clean.

VAJ7Y-JNGi5zW-gDYIptOA.text: This place is a great mix of elegant Italian dining and neighborhood pizza joint. Everything from the pizza to the calamari is tasty. A nice house sauce and a great environment.

4k3Vv9UdJp4YJBkWd2RJuw.text: I am from NJ and I know good pizza.  This place has good NYC style pizza.  I can't believe the bad reviews it has gotten.  Before you make any judgments just swing by and have a slice.  If you know good pizza, you will like this place.

WUSaFVosldxjhKoJ_GfltA.text: My family loves this place. Their house balsamic dressing and homemade bread are worth the trip alone. Try the eggplant rollatini if you enjoy eggplant. The only thing is I don't care for their meat sauce.

B40yoeHi20aokIXBcre-xw.text: I haven't been in Charlotte very long...only two months and I must say it's truly culinary HELL! I didn't realize it was so hard to find any good food around here. I've eaten at the best of the best restaurants in most major U.S. cities so I know good food. With that said, this establishment is a really good place to nosh. The food is fresh and tastes a lot like real Italian food. While, I haven't tried their pizza, I do know that their calzones are delicious. They use 2 different types of cheeses and their dough is amazing. Fried cheese is also amazing! I've tried 3 pasta dishes and all were piping hot, fresh and delicious. Their pizza is next on my list as it's been REALLY difficult to find any really good pizza here. I found one place that has NY style pizza that's pretty good...Hawthorne's. I strongly disagree with any bad reviews this place has received. Maybe it's gotten better since their reviews, I don't know. I've always had good service here as well. For me to write  a positive review really means something. Also, keep in mind, everyone's taste buds are different but I don't think you will be disappointed!

sEvBTmDG0PIxzJIVfVtqbw.text: First of all, let me say that this review is one star, because there is not an option to give it ZERO stars.  We do not dine in the restaurant because we do not enjoy the atmosphere. Therefore, we place orders for pick up. When I place the order, I have a 50/50 chance that the employee taking the order is rude. However, if ever place an order with one of the owners, they are ALWAYS rude...for that they get 100% consistency. One of the servers is always very nice and the younger cook who prepares the pizzas is as well.(I'll give credit where credit is due and they deserve it.)  Also, there are a couple of items on the menu that my husband and I do like alot. However, we NEVER get what we order when we actually pick up our order. After getting home with our order, I have called a to let them know of their mistake and the owner is even MORE rude than before. My intention is not to get a refund. I just want what I paid for, not what they gave me because they were too busy to listen. Among a number of rude responses, here are a few classics.... "It is Friday. We are busy....the order is not always right",..... "Bring back the food and I will give you what you ordered", after which I told him, "I can not drive 10 miles back tonight, but I will come in tomorrow." He said, "You have to bring the salad back with you tomorrow" and another....."it's not my fault." NEVER did I receive an apology....even an insincere one. Nor, did I receive a "we'll correct this for you." Yes, now I am being rude, but please know that I was NEVER anything less that polite to anyone in that restaurant. He is a business owner in a small town that needs support of his community. We need business owners that appreciate patrions and I have been a patrion for over 2 years with no appreciation. I want to support my local businesses, but will no longer support this one.  He does not appreciate my business and I will never place an order with him again.  He will fail eventually and when he does, I'll take back my damn salad the day his doors close. In the meantime, I will make sure my fellow citizens of Harrisburg will know of my experience of this rude, ungratefule man....and that he is has no interest in our community. In closing, a little note to Captain Rudeness.....When your business fails miserably because of your disregard to your customers, I will NOT say, "It is not my fault." because I'll do all i can to make sure it is!
